ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jonathan's office hours were most convenient to my schedule and he was incredibly patient and thorough.
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Harris Jonathan
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jonathan
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jonathan Harris
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jonathan was fantastic - always helpful and available to chat with.
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jon Harris
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Lan graded my homework but I went to both Jonathan and Lan's office hours.
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jonathan Harris
Instructor: Lan Tang  Had to interact with the assigned TF purely because they were the main grader.
Instructor: Lan Tang  Lan Tang
Instructor: Lan Tang  Tan was very helpful with homework and knowledgeable about statistics.
Instructor: Lan Tang  Very helpful!!!
Instructor: Lan Tang  Lan Tang
Instructor: Lan Tang  Lan graded my homework but I went to both Jonathan and Lan's office hours.
Instructor: Lan Tang  most closely to Lan Tang
Instructor: Lan Tang  I interacted most closely with Lan Tang.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jonathan graded my assignments and provided helpful feedback.
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Strengths: patient, available, and able to translate concepts into layman's terms
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Creative in providing illustrations on statistical concepts
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jonathan was thorough and helpful during office hours.

Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jonathan was super helpful in helping me understand, although his office hours were at a slightly inconvenient time. He was very patient and used common language to help us understand the tough stats concepts. He also went above and beyond to follow up if we had an issue or a question that he couldnt answer
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  I thought homework feedback was clear, concise, and returned in a timely manner.
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jonathan was extremely friendly and helpful in the lab. He was willing and able to explain the material. Jonathan will make a tremendous teacher.
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Jonathan was very patient but the explanations were a bit lengthier and more complex than I think they may have needed to be.
Instructor: Jonathan Rogers Harris  Very helpful homework grading comments.
Instructor: Lan Tang  Very okay
Instructor: Lan Tang  Poor communicator. T/F sessions were not helpful as compared to Jonathan.

Instructor: Lan Tang  Lan was helpful during office hours, though we sometimes had trouble getting on the same page with questions and explanations. Overall, I appreciated her help. I sometimes felt that the grading was inconsistent or a little too strict, but I am not sure if that had to do with the TA or the rubric for grading.
Instructor: Lan Tang  She was great
Instructor: Lan Tang  Lan was very helpful in the lab and did a great job explaining concepts from the class. Overall she was excellent.

Instructor: Lan Tang  Lan was an extremely harsh grader which frankly took away from the learning experience of the problem sets and midterms. Her explanations in office hours were more complex than they needed to be and could have been clearer and more straightforward.
Instructor: Lan Tang  She is Okay.
Instructor: Lan Tang  My teaching assistant provided excellent feedback on homework assignments and was helpful during office hours.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Question 14: This was quite possibly the best-taught math-related course I've ever taken, and also ranks up in the top courses that I've ever taken of any subject. Question 13: It's almost unbelievable how Professor Reuning-Scherer can take almost any topic and make it perfectly clear and accessible to students. He is an exceptional teacher.

The professor makes himself available for questions on multiple platforms (office hours, group question hours, cell phone, skype, email) in order to meet students where they feel most comfortable. He is very responsive, patient, and enthusiastic. To accomodate different learning styles, he offers two different class structures, written notes, class recordings, educational videos, optional quizzes, and free online references. I felt that if I didn't do well, it was for lack of effort on my part because Jonathan wants everyone to succeed so badly.

I thought this was a really fantastic course. I really appreciated the professor's realistic views on the best way for us to learn statistics. Understanding that it is unlikely we will be completing statistic analysis in the future without any resources, he allowed us to use notes on all our assignments and receive assistance from the TAs and from him when necessary. This helped transition the focus from memorizing formulas to gaining a deeper understanding of the topic and how to apply it. I was very appreciative of this approach and I learned a ton! The professor is funny, kind and very available!
The Instructor made the class very interactive with graphic illustrations.

Though statistics has always been a difficult subject area for me to grasp, I thought the course did a good job reinforcing concepts that I had learned in the past, and teaching me new ones. Jonathan made it accessible and interesting, though it moved quite fast at times.
Jonathan is the best. Not only did he really make stats come alive with his quirky jonathanisms, but he was incredibly enthusiastic about the material.

I think this course is a little more challenging for those who don't have ready applications for the material covered. Coming up with a final project was especially difficult...I had no idea where to start. About halfway through the semester, the material got very hard to follow in class, and I spent a lot of time reviewing videos outside of class. Maybe the pace could be slowed a bit.

JDRS is an amazing professor! He made statistics interesting, nteractive and relevant. I greatly appreciate his humor and learning pneumonics. My classmates and I were always very impressed by his responsiveness to questions (even during the election - and about statistics not related to class) and depth of knowledge. I did not purchase any statistic text books, but i may have if I knew that there were additional problems that would help me understand the material beyond the homework.
The class was too fast paced. The lectures went too fast and it was difficult to follow.

I felt like the pace of this course was too quick to really understand deeply the complex material. I also felt like the teaching style, while fun, was not always conducive to actual learning. By using phrases like "what does buzz lightyear say" it prompts the students to say infinity but they don't actually know that the answer is infinity, or why it is infinity, and they wouldn't have been able to come up with that answer without the prompt.

I would have preferred if we had learned slightly less material but done a deeper dive of each concept so we had a firmer grasp of the material. Also I thought the second midterm and project was a bit heavy and maybe could have been spaced out better or adjusted.
I will answer as followings
I took the course to refamiliarize myself with basic statistical concepts I'd previously learned but forgotten in my undergraduate studies. This course was helpful in achieving this.
To question 1, I didn't spend time to read the optional textbooks. The PowerPoint slides were good enough.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Great professor, very helpful and available outside of class!
JRS is an incredibly engaging teacher.
Practical aspect of using minitab to perform regression and logistic regression
Jonathan's teaching style.
Definitely Jonathan's enthusiasm (in other words, the lecture)
The instructor is fantastic and engaging. Homeworks were great for helping to synthesize info.
Jonathan's personality and teaching style
The professor, and finally having an understanding of statistics

For me, having the option of watching the course online from home and still receiving participation through clicker points was extremely helpful, as I was sick or had athletic competition on at least three occasions during the semester. Professor Reuning-Scherer's engagement with us, be it through jokes or through countless hours of availability, was much appreciated.

This course is super helpful in getting through a lot of material in a short amount of time. There is no shortage of ways to learn the material as well - with lectures, online videos, notes and TA/Instructor Office hours throughout the week.
The final project
The problem sets were very helpful in practicing what was taught in the class. I felt like I learned the most from the problem sets.
Solid states knowledge and entertainment from JDRS
- content was very relevant - examples were relatable - notes were extremely helpful - lots of office hours
JRS has lots of experience and is an excellent instructor. He is very high energy and classes are very engaging. He wants each student to succeed and makes class time fun.
Jonathan is an excellent teacher and very available.
It is a kind of comprehensive introductory class.

I think thanks to Jonathan's explanations I will be less likely to forget stats as I did before. He put so much effort in providing explanations that are memorable and entertaining. Even when (mostly due to necessary class size) the student participation was slow, which must be terribly discouraging. However, I know from a lot of classmates that they never had as much fun doing stats before.
The professor was entertaining and engaging in his lectures.
Great instructor, very clear in explaining abstract statistical concepts.
I have a better understanding of statistics and know how to complete basic analyses.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The non-flipped version of this class didn't have much opportunity for questions and discussion. I think it would have been more helpful to have held it in the CSSSI stat lab.

I thought we could have spent a bit more time on the final project. It would have been helpful to have a bit more guidance selecting data. Our group chose challenging data and it made the project less fun/interesting. Walking us through the expectations for the final project for a portion of a class would have been helpful. Also -- I think four people in a group might be too many. Perhaps you should limit groups to three.

1. TF's with better communication skills and clear grading protocols. 2. Removal of the reference made to Francis Dalton & Eugenics (regression notes) could be helpful for students made uncomfortable by reference to the latter.
The pace was very fast, but I guess that's to be expected or an intro course in graduate school.
another TA with more convenient office hours would be helpful
I think the pace in the second half of the semester could be slowed a bit.
The pace in lecture cold be improved upon, at times Jonathan talks a little too fast during lecture and it's hard to follow along in the lecture slides.

I understand how the course builds on itself throughout the semester, but I wish there had been a bit more time spent on ANOVAs and multiple regressions (I know, there is another class on it, but still!!)

This isn't necessarily a negative, but I will say that for this class you get out what you put into it. It can be easy to coast in a class like this, but in doing so you won't absorb or learn the material.
The lecture style

I enjoyed the interactive parts of the class (with the clickers) but they often did not work. Those sessions helped me identify what I did and did not understand, and helped me focus on what to study further. I think this part of the course needs improvement, and ideally could be incorporated into every class meeting.
none! I thought the course was excellent!
I just thought it was a bit fast paced, that being said we covered a lot of concepts necessary to get a grasp on stats.
9iThe connections with environmental issues.
I usually learn more of there is a closed book exam, but I understand the complications of that.
At times the lecture slides moved quite fast (although having them online was very helpful).

The final project seems a little disconnected with the class overall. Perhaps a final project would be more helpful in a more advanced statistics course. Often times it took a few weeks assignments to be graded.
The lectures were fast-paced and engaging, but it was difficult for the material to soak in. I would recommend more frequent in-class review of concepts.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Effective
Yes it was effective.

I wish the TAs had more office hours. They got super crowded and we had to wait a long time to get help. I should've gone to Jonathan more often although it was a bit annoying how he was late a few times and it thus got crowded, but I do appreciate how available he made himself and how good he is at explaining things.
It is okay.
It was great, no improvements come to mind.
Homework was relevant to lectures.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Understanding statistical model outputs and vocabulary is central to any environmental career. It's empowering to understand statistics and be able to participate in broader conversations now.
Being able to statistically analyze massive amounts of data is useful for any field.
The course is relevant because it provides skills for research data analysis and interpretation- key to decision making and coming up with research evidence.

Statistics is essential for my degree, as I will be conducting quantitative field research, and I will need to apply the skills I learned in this class to the analysis of the data that I will be collecting next summer.
while im not entirely sure how i will be using stats in life, it's a helpful subject to know, if only for ease of reading scientific papers.
I am very interested in data science and analytics - statistics is the first step to understanding that!

As an environmental studies major, this course provided relevant environmental situations and invaluable practice with statistical analysis applicable to research, advocacy, marketing, or consulting within the environmental field.

Great course for any FES student since it provides you with the foundation knowledge needed to continue our work and analyze information that we are presented with. As someone focused on policy issues, this is incredibly important to me.
I think statistics is a crucial still to have, which is why I took this course.
This class is a good practical skill for environmentalists.
Good review of basic statistical concepts that I learned only superficially in college.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Statistics is crucial to my career path and necessary for my independent research plans.
Interest in gaining a background/overview in statistics.
I was hoping to gain some numerical analytical skills in time for my summer internship. This course fulfilled that goal.
I needed to learn to do statistical analysis by myself as a scientist.
See above.
general interest / lack of prior experience
I wanted a baseline understanding of statistics in order to understand information delivered to me in a policy/management context.
I had zero stats experience before this class and I needed the exposure.
Statistics are a necessary evil. As is the Central Limit Theorem.
To strengthen my previous knowledge of statistics, to gain skills and experience with statistical theory and analysis software, to fulfill an Environmental Studies major requirement
To gain baseline knowledge of stats for my future work.
I think everyone should have a basic understanding of statistics.
To learn statistics
This is a required course for my program. It was also critical for my ability to conduct my summer research.
To learn/refresh on statistics- this is very important to understand how people are presenting their data. A necessary set of skills for anyone working in the sciences.
i took ap stat and felt like I needed a refresher
I want to learn more hard skills.
I actually wanted to understand stats papers better, because I forgot most of what I learned in undergrad stats.
To brush up on my statistics background.
I need a review of basic statistical concepts before taking more advance stats classes relevant to my thesis work.
I wanted to understand how to interpret and create accurate statistics.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Definitely
Yes
Yes it did. I need to continue practicing on it to be better.
Yes
I have a much better understanding of statistical concepts, and how to use them. I do not feel entirely comfortable with all of the concepts that we learned.
Somewhat--I thought I'd have a better idea of how to use these concepts.
Yes
Yes.
Yes, in fact I am considering taking Data Analysis or a similar next-level course to continue my studies in fitting best models.
Yes, however, I think for some parts of the course I wasn't as fully invested which resulted in some gaps in knowledge that I wish I had.

I thought I would leave this course with a more solid understanding of statistics. I think towards the end of the course we started to rush through content, and I do not have as good of a grasp of what we covered near the end.
yes
Yes, exceeded my expectations!
Yes. If I wasn't so busy I could have learned more.

I wish I had a firmer grasp of the concepts. I would've preferred getting the handout on when to use each method in the beginning because that was the most important/useful to me. I think there should be a greater emphasis on that somehow (E.g. the quizzes)
Yes
I feel I did not get very much about the contents in the latter of this class.
Yes. I wished I would have put more effort into the additional materials to understand it to a deeper level, but all the materials are provided so I can revisit it, which I can appreciate.
Yes
YES

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantages: leaning on the expertise of my peers Disadvantages: scheduling difficulties and different styles in approaching group work
N/A

Working on the final project with a group was helpful and efficient. The project has the potential to be large and unwieldy, so having other group members to coordinate with made a big difference. We were also able to help each other review the material that we needed to know for the analysis of our dataset.

group work mimicked real life project creation. while it seemed that my group was going to have a week leg, but it turned out fine. the group work is vital to our understanding of stats as it helps to be part of a real-life stats analysis from start to finish, as opposed to analyzing data that Jonathan has found for us.
It was good because then with our shared understanding of statisitcs we were able to teach each other and reinforce ideas. The biggest difficulty with group work was coordinating schedules.
I enjoyed working through data analysis with two other group members, because we all were able to share different ideas for transforming and interpreting the data.
Working with groups was very helpful because group members could help explain difficult concepts to each other.
It was nice to have multiple perspectives to do the right tests but working with people with different study habits was stressful
NA

Working in a group for the final project was definitely helpful in crystalizing my understandings of the concepts used in the class, as I and my partner could supplement each others' strengths when needed.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Statistics is probably the single most important class you can possibly take out of any subject, and this class is one of the best-taught statistics classes I've ever seen. Everyone should take this class
Go to Jonathan's office hours. He wants you to succeed. Let him help you. Don't fall behind. Print the class notes and make side notes in class.
Keep at it. Go to every office hours for homework help. If you go to class, you will make it through the semester.
This is a great course. I would take it.
Review the notes and use the lab on a weekly basis.
Very useful
Go to office hours, and use your classmates, and TAs as resources. I think it would be far more difficult without these resources.
never skip lecture, and turn your cellphone off during it.
Attend all the lectures! A lot gets covered and its hard to catch up if you miss them.

Take the flipped version, I wish I had taken the flipped course because you have the freedom to pause, rewind, and re-watch the videos when Jonathan moves too fast... you don't have that luxury in the lecture.
Take it! Especially if you have never taken stats before!!
This subject is vital to whatever field you choose to pursue- definitely take, even if you're an undergraduate!
If you haven't taken a statistics course - or its been a few years - this is a great refresher that really builds on the knowledge you learn in other courses.

This course teaches a fundamental skill that everyone should understand, and so I would recommend taking it to get that skill. However, the class requires a lot of self teaching and some of the instructor's teaching practices help you get the right answer but do not always help you understand why that is the right answer.
take it
Go to office hours as often as possible!
Keep up with the coursework so you don't fall behind.
Take advantage of office horus
It will be good to study if you really need to use this skill in the future.
This course is as entertaining and informative as a stats course can posssibly be. Take it.
It's a good course to introduce or reintroduce you to statistical concepts. If you feel like your background in the topic is strong though, there are others that might be more valuable.
Keep up the pace. Set a few hours to review course materials every weekend. Don't fall behind. Don't procrastinate.
